channel.title: Problem with shops in client.java

item.title: Problem with shops in client.java
item.dc:creator: @znick55 znick55
item.description:
@znick55 wrote:

i changed it to

[code=java]case 17:
NPCSlot = ((misc.HexToInt(inStream.buffer, 0, packetSize) / 1000) - 128);
NPCID = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType;
faceNPC(NPCSlot);
PutNPCCoords = false;

		switch (NPCID) {

			case 1597://slayermaster
				PutNPCCoords = true;
				WanneShop = 1; //pkshop
				break;

			
	}
	break;[/code]

well i get no compile errors but when i trade him still nothing happens…

item.title: Problem with shops in client.java
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You use case’s inside of a switch statement.

Ex: if (NPCID == 1597)
Would be:

 case 1597:

item.title: Problem with shops in client.java
item.dc:creator: @znick55 znick55
item.description:
@znick55 wrote:

ok so i coded this my self so i didnt expect it to work, but there were to compile errors, but when i try to trade the slayer master(the shop keeper) nothing happens… does anyone see anything wrong with this code?

[code=java]case 17:
NPCSlot = ((misc.HexToInt(inStream.buffer, 0, packetSize) / 1000) - 128);
NPCID = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType;
faceNPC(NPCSlot);
PutNPCCoords = false;

		switch (NPCID) {

	} if (NPCID == 1597) { //slayermaster
				PutNPCCoords = true;
				WanneShop = 1; //pkshop
	} else {
				break;

			
	}
	break;
	case 72:[/code]
